content.user_title: Generate Employment Contracts and HR Documents
content.value_statement: Create legally sound employment documents quickly and consistently. This skill provides professionally drafted templates for contracts, offer letters, and HR policies that comply with employment law best practices.
actual_capabilities: Generate offer letters with compensation and benefits details
Create employment agreements with confidentiality and IP clauses
Draft employee handbook sections with policies and procedures
Include jurisdiction-specific legal considerations and disclaimers
Provide best practices for employment document creation
limitations: Templates require customization for specific jurisdictions
Does not constitute legal advice - counsel review recommended
Covers US employment law primarily - may need adaptation for other countries
Templates are starting points - not comprehensive legal documents

use_cases.title: Standardize employment documentation
use_cases.description: Create consistent offer letters and contracts across your organization with proper legal language and company policies.

use_cases.title: Draft first employment agreements
use_cases.description: Generate professional employment contracts when hiring your first employees with appropriate legal protections.

use_cases.title: Template starting points
use_cases.description: Use as foundation for customized employment documents, saving time on standard clauses and formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Offer Letter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an offer letter for a software engineer position with $120,000 salary, including standard benefits and at-will employment language.

prompt_templates.title: Employment Contract
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an employment agreement for a senior designer including confidentiality, IP assignment, and 12-month non-compete clauses.

prompt_templates.title: Employee Handbook Section
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a remote work policy section for an employee handbook covering equipment, hours, and communication expectations.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Employment Document
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an employment contract for a part-time CFO including equity compensation, flexible hours, and specific termination clauses.

output_examples.input: Generate an offer letter for a marketing manager with $95,000 salary and standard benefits
output: Professional offer letter with company letterhead
Benefits: health insurance, 401k with 4% match, 15 days PTO
Position details: Marketing Manager, reports to VP Marketing
At-will employment clause with acceptance instructions
Legal disclaimer stating this is not a contract

output_examples.input: Create an employment contract for a software developer with non-compete and IP assignment clauses
output: Formal employment agreement with defined term and at-will provisions
Confidentiality obligations covering trade secrets and proprietary information
IP assignment clause transferring work product to employer
Non-compete restriction: 12 months post-termination within geographic area
Non-solicitation clauses for customers and employees

best_practices: Always customize templates for your specific jurisdiction and company requirements
Have legal counsel review all employment documents before use
Include appropriate disclaimers about at-will employment where applicable
anti_patterns: Using templates without jurisdiction-specific legal review
Making promises in offer letters that create implied contracts

faq.question: Are these templates legally binding?
faq.answer: Templates are starting points that require customization. Always have legal counsel review before use to ensure compliance with local laws.

faq.question: Which jurisdictions do these templates cover?
faq.answer: Templates are based on US employment law. International users must adapt for local regulations and employment standards.

faq.question: Can I modify the generated documents?
faq.answer: Yes, templates are meant to be customized. Edit sections to match your company policies, compensation structure, and legal requirements.

faq.question: How do I ensure data privacy when using these templates?
faq.answer: Remove all personal information from examples. Use placeholder text like [EMPLOYEE NAME] instead of real names in your prompts.

faq.question: What if I need industry-specific clauses?
faq.answer: Add industry-specific language after generation. Templates provide standard employment terms that work across most industries.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring an employment lawyer?
faq.answer: This skill provides cost-effective templates for standard situations. Complex arrangements or high-risk hires still require professional legal advice.
